it.polimi.se2019.server.games.board

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.server.games.board.Tile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Targetable, java.io.Serializable

    public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
implements Targetable
    This class is used to represent a single square of the map. There are methods to manage weapon crates and ammo crates on each tile.
    Author:
    Rodolfo Mariotti
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Tile

        public Tile(java.lang.String id,
            LinkType[] links,
            RoomColor roomColor,
            int xPosition,
            int yPosition)
        Tile constructor. Initializes a new tile.
        Parameters:
        id - unique identifier
        links - link type for every cardinal position
        roomColor - color of the tile
        xPosition - x coordinate of the tile in the map
        yPosition - y coordinate of the tile in the mao

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Tile is a Targetable object so it has an id. This method is the getter for the id attribute.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        unique identifier of the tile

        public RoomColor getRoomColor()

      • getVisibleTiles

        public java.util.List<Tile> getVisibleTiles(Board board)
        Gets the list of tiles visible from this tile, so each tile of the room and the tiles of each room connected to this tile by an open link or a door link.
        Parameters:
        board - board where this tile is
        Returns:
        list of visible tiles

      • getVisibleTargets

        public java.util.List<Player> getVisibleTargets(Game game)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        list of visible targets

      • getRoom

        public java.util.List<Tile> getRoom(Board board)
        Get the tiles that have the same room color. The group of tiles with the same colors form a room.
        Parameters:
        board - board where this tile is
        Returns:
        tiles of the same room

        public boolean isSpawnTile()
